greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Reversed reduced frequency counts for A004001: a(n) = A265754(A054429(n)).
comment: Deleting all 1's and decrementing the remaining terms by one gives the sequence back.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8191
T. Kubo and R. Vakil, On Conway's recursive sequence, Discr. Math. 152 (1996), 225-252.
example: Illustration how the sequence can be constructed by concatenating the reversed reduced frequency counts R_n of each successive level n of A004001-tree:
xref: Cf. A000079 (positions of records, where n appears for the first time).
Cf. A265754 (obtained from the mirror image of the same tree).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 22 2016
